channel.title: Three Things - A Podcast of the Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics & Economics
channel.itunes:summary: Hosted by David Iglesias, Director of the Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics and Economics at Wheaton College (IL), Three Things explores modern issues surrounding faith, politics, and economics -- or three things our parents taught us not to talk to strangers about. Join us for conversations that explore topics in a measured, civil and winsome way.

item.title: Three Things Podcast - The Hamilton Hold
item.itunes:title: Three Things Podcast - The Hamilton Hold
item.description: “Dr. Bob” Hamilton, proud parent of two Wheaton College graduates and owner of Pacific Ocean Pediatrics shares what it takes to run a small independent medical practice and the background of how his famous baby calming technique, the “Hamilton Hold,” went viral.

item.itunes:title: Amsted Industries, an Employee Owned Company
item.description: Stephen R. Smith, Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of Amsted Industries Incorporated shares the benefits of  Employee Stock Ownership Plans (ESOPs) and also how Amsted has navigated Covid and supply chain issues. Interview date: March 2, 2022

item.title: Three Things Podcast - From Wheaton to the World and Back, an Interview with Don Holt
item.itunes:title: Three Things Podcast - From Wheaton to the World and Back, an Interview with Don Holt
item.description: Don Holt '57 is a Wheaton College alumnus and former editor of Fortune magazine, Newsweek magazine, Journal of Commerce, and The Chicago Daily News. He was one of the first Wheaton alumni to work in major news media and then after he retired, he returned to Wheaton College and trained the next generation.
item.content:encoded: Don Holt '57 is a Wheaton College alumnus and former editor of Fortune magazine, Newsweek magazine, Journal of Commerce, and The Chicago Daily News. He was one of the first Wheaton alumni to work in major news media and then after he retired, he returned to Wheaton College and trained the next generation.

item.title: From the barrios of Texas to the White House, the amazing story of Rebecca Contreras
item.itunes:title: From the barrios of Texas to the White House, the amazing story of Rebecca Contreras
item.description: Rebecca Contreras served as an executive and chief advisory to the Secretary in the role of Deputy Assistant Secretary and Chief Human Capital Officer at the U.S. Department of Treasury.  She also served as a Member on the government-wide Chief Human Capital Officer’s Council advising Congress and the President on Workforce issues. Prior to that she served as a Commissioned Officer in the White House as Special Assistant for Personnel to President George W. Bush.
item.content:encoded: Rebecca Contreras served as an executive and chief advisory to the Secretary in the role of Deputy Assistant Secretary and Chief Human Capital Officer at the U.S. Department of Treasury.  She also served as a Member on the government-wide Chief Human Capital Officer’s Council advising Congress and the President on Workforce issues. Prior to that she served as a Commissioned Officer in the White House as Special Assistant for Personnel to President George W. Bush.

item.title: Facing Life’s Unexpected Challenges with Courage - An Interview with Jeff Parnell
item.itunes:title: Facing Life’s Unexpected Challenges with Courage - An Interview with Jeff Parnell
item.description: Jeff Parnell is the President & CEO of FishUSA, a leading online retailer of sport fishing products. He discusses the (positive) impact that Covid-19 has had on fishing retail, how his faith has impacted and informed his work and how an unexpected physical challenge required a new level of faith and courage.
item.content:encoded: Jeff Parnell is the President & CEO of FishUSA, a leading online retailer of sport fishing products. He discusses the (positive) impact that Covid-19 has had on fishing retail, how his faith has impacted and informed his work and how an unexpected physical challenge required a new level of faith and courage.

item.title: Fighting the Global Plague of Human Trafficking - An Interview with Ambassador-at-Large, John Cotton Richmond
item.itunes:title: Fighting the Global Plague of Human Trafficking - An Interview with Ambassador-at-Large, John Cotton Richmond
item.description: Ambassador Richmond comes to the highest position in the federal government dedicated to combating human trafficking, after a distinguished career in the global battle for freedom. He co-founded the Human Trafficking Institute that exists to decimate modern slavery at its source by empowering police and prosecutors to use victim-centered and trauma-informed methods to hold traffickers accountable and ensure survivors are treated with respect and care. Prior to the Institute, Ambassador Richmond served as a federal prosecutor in the U.S. Department of Justice’s Human Trafficking Prosecution Unit. Ambassador Richmond regularly served as an expert to the United Nations Working Group on Trafficking in Persons. He also lived in India for three years pioneering International Justice Mission’s anti-slavery work.
item.content:encoded: Ambassador Richmond comes to the highest position in the federal government dedicated to combating human trafficking, after a distinguished career in the global battle for freedom. He co-founded the Human Trafficking Institute that exists to decimate modern slavery at its source by empowering police and prosecutors to use victim-centered and trauma-informed methods to hold traffickers accountable and ensure survivors are treated with respect and care. Prior to the Institute, Ambassador Richmond served as a federal prosecutor in the U.S. Department of Justice’s Human Trafficking Prosecution Unit. Ambassador Richmond regularly served as an expert to the United Nations Working Group on Trafficking in Persons. He also lived in India for three years pioneering International Justice Mission’s anti-slavery work.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ambassador Richmond comes to the highest position in the federal government dedicated to combating human trafficking, after a distinguished career in the global battle for freedom. He co-founded the Human Trafficking Institute that exists to decimate...

item.title: From Venezuela to American Brain Trauma Specialist - An Interview with Dr. Marcel Ponton
item.itunes:title: From Venezuela to American Brain Trauma Specialist - An Interview with Dr. Marcel Ponton
item.description: Dr. Pontón is the CEO and Founder of Persona Neurobehavior Group. For the past 27+ years, he has focused on the neuropsychological assessment and treatment of individuals with catastrophic injuries. He is an expert witness in the fields of head injury and trauma. Dr Pontón is also an Associate Clinical Professor in the Department of Psychiatry at UCLA.
item.content:encoded: Dr. Pontón is the CEO and Founder of Persona Neurobehavior Group. For the past 27+ years, he has focused on the neuropsychological assessment and treatment of individuals with catastrophic injuries. He is an expert witness in the fields of head injury and trauma. Dr Pontón is also an Associate Clinical Professor in the Department of Psychiatry at UCLA.

item.title: Triple Threat - An Interview with the Honorable J.C. Watts, former U.S. Representative from Oklahoma, 1995-2003
item.itunes:title: Triple Threat - An Interview with the Honorable J.C. Watts, former U.S. Representative from Oklahoma, 1995-2003
item.description: Former Quarterback for the University of Oklahoma Sooners goes on to excel in all three areas of faith, politics, and economics.

item.title: First U.S. Latina Lt. Governor - An Interview with Evelyn Sanguinetti
item.itunes:title: First U.S. Latina Lt. Governor - An Interview with Evelyn Sanguinetti
item.description: Evelyn Sanguinetti shares how she rose to become the first Lt. Governor (Illinois) in the United States from a mother who was a Cuban refugee and a father who was an Ecuadorian immigrant.  She also overcame a serious injury and a subsequent MS diagnosis.  She now works with HOPE fair housing center to help guarantee fair housing for all.
item.content:encoded: Evelyn Sanguinetti shares how she rose to become the first Lt. Governor (Illinois) in the United States from a mother who was a Cuban refugee and a father who was an Ecuadorian immigrant.  She also overcame a serious injury and a subsequent MS diagnosis.  She now works with HOPE fair housing center to help guarantee fair housing for all.

item.title: The International Study Program - 50 years of shaping future Wheaton leaders
item.itunes:title: The International Study Program - 50 years of shaping future Wheaton leaders
item.description: Join alumni, David Iglesias, Larry Absheer, Dan Johnson, Karen Gehl and Mark Mooney as they share how their time on the International Study Program at Wheaton College helped shape their lives. The Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics, & Economics plans to continue this opportunity with a trip to the Nordic countries this summer, 2021.
item.content:encoded: Join alumni, David Iglesias, Larry Absheer, Dan Johnson, Karen Gehl and Mark Mooney as they share how their time on the International Study Program at Wheaton College helped shape their lives. The Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics, & Economics plans to continue this opportunity with a trip to the Nordic countries this summer, 2021.

item.title: The American Dream Attained: An Interview with Ed Moy
item.itunes:title: The American Dream Attained: An Interview with Ed Moy
item.description: Ed Moy began as a child of immigrant parents from China and advanced all the way to the White House as President George W. Bush’s Special Assistant to the President for Presidential Personnel from 2001-2006.  He was then appointed as the 38th Director of the U.S. Mint from 2006-2011.
item.content:encoded: Ed Moy began as a child of immigrant parents from China and advanced all the way to the White House as President George W. item.title: Overcoming Adversities: An Interview with Judge Nelson Diaz
item.itunes:title: Overcoming Adversities: An Interview with Judge Nelson Diaz
item.description: Judge Nelson Diaz shares his story, rising from the tenement housing in New York to General Counsel to the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.  Judge Diaz was the 1st Puerto Rican admitted to the Pennsylvania Bar and the 1st Latino judge in the Court of Common Pleas in Pennsylvania. He was awarded the National Institute for Justice Award for saving the courts $100 million in 10 years and eliminating 7 years of backlogged cases.
item.content:encoded: Judge Nelson Diaz shares his story, rising from the tenement housing in New York to General Counsel to the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.  Judge Diaz was the 1st Puerto Rican admitted to the Pennsylvania Bar and the 1st Latino judge in the Court of Common Pleas in Pennsylvania. He was awarded the National Institute for Justice Award for saving the courts $100 million in 10 years and eliminating 7 years of backlogged cases.

item.itunes:title: On the Fast Track: An Interview With Redbox CEO Galen Smith '98

item.title: The CEO: Interview with Dr. C. William Pollard - Part 1
item.itunes:title: The CEO: Interview with Dr. C. William Pollard
item.description: Dr. C. William Pollard, former CEO of ServiceMaster, shares Christian principles that shaped his choices in the workforce, including a Christian perspective on profit.  Join us in two weeks for the second half of this interview which includes insights on the Faith @ Work movement and his friendship with Billy Graham.

William Pollard, former CEO of ServiceMaster, shares Christian principles that shaped his choices in the workforce, including a Christian perspective on profit.  Join us in two weeks for the second half of this interview which includes insights on the Faith @ Work movement and his friendship with Billy Graham.

item.title: Conscience of an Industry: An Interview with Shundrawn Thomas
item.itunes:title: Conscience of an Industry: Interview with Shundrawn Thomas
item.description: Join David Iglesias as he interviews Shundrawn Thomas, President of Northern Trust Asset Management, where they explore a wide range of topics including: Shundrawn’s personal path to business success, the importance of family, lessons on leadership, insights on racism, his new book Discover Joy in Work, and potential opportunities stemming from our current COVID–19 crisis.
item.content:encoded: Join David Iglesias as he interviews Shundrawn Thomas, President of Northern Trust Asset Management, where they explore a wide range of topics including: Shundrawn’s personal path to business success, the importance of family, lessons on leadership, insights on racism, his new book Discover Joy in Work, and potential opportunities stemming from our current COVID–19 crisis.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Shundrawn Thomas
item.itunes:author: Wheaton College

item.title: D-Day Survivor: Interview with Dr. Richard Rung
item.itunes:title: D-Day Survivor: Interview with Dr. Richard Rung
item.description: On June 6, 2020, we celebrated the 76th anniversary of D-Day. In this episode, Wheaton honorary alum and retired Wheaton College Political Science professor, Dr. Richard Rung, shares his recollections of his participation in this historic day. Commemorate this recent anniversary with memories from someone who was there!
item.content:encoded: On June 6, 2020, we celebrated the 76th anniversary of D-Day. In this episode, Wheaton honorary alum and retired Wheaton College Political Science professor, Dr. Richard Rung, shares his recollections of his participation in this historic day. Commemorate this recent anniversary with memories from someone who was there!
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Dr. Richard Rung
item.itunes:author: Wheaton College

item.title: Innovative COO of Tennessee: An Interview with Greg Adams
item.itunes:title: Innovative COO of Tennessee: Interview with Greg Adams
item.description: Meet Greg Adams, the new chairman of the Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics and Economics Board, and hear how he took his 37 years at IBM and used it to serve as the COO of Tennessee.  Learn from his faith journey and how it impacted his work in both the business world and government service.
item.content:encoded: Meet Greg Adams, the new chairman of the Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics and Economics Board, and hear how he took his 37 years at IBM and used it to serve as the COO of Tennessee.  Learn from his faith journey and how it impacted his work in both the business world and government service.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Greg Adams
item.itunes:author: Wheaton College

item.title: COVID-19 Infectious Disease Expert: An Interview with Dr. Doug Drevets
item.itunes:title: COVID-19 Infectious Disease Expert: Interview with Dr. Doug Drevets
item.description: David Iglesias, Director of the Wheaton Center for Faith, Politics and Economics, interviews infectious disease specialist Dr. Doug Drevets '80 about COVID19. Dr. Drevets offers insights from science and faith to inform and encourage during these challenging times.
